page.title: 18Recent History of Bletchley
page.content: Whaddon Way is the main road through Bletchley.It used to be just a narrow country road with fields around it.Bletchley was a nice farming town with only a few roads and not very busy. Not long ago the population was was 8,000 but it is now 28,000.Only a quarter of the people who now live in Bletchley came before the 1980's. Bletchley Park was used to decode German messages during the war.The Brickworks was the main place of enployment. During the war a Womans Land Army hostel was in Church Green Road.They worked on the land when their husbands were at war. The Cattle Market stood where Sainsbury's is now.
